data.title: Mavis Staples at Symphony Center, Chicago
data.meta_description: Join the living legend for an evening of soul, gospel, and her signature brand of R&B.
data.text:
ANNOUNCER: This program is available with Passport, because of your generous donation to your local PBS station.

Thank you.

(audience cheering and applauding) (audience applauding) ♪ ("For What It's Worth") (audience applauding) ♪ (audience cheering) ♪ (clapping) RICK: Chicago, (audience cheering) are you ready?

♪ I don't believe you.

♪ Are you ready?

(audience cheering) Well put your hands together and make her feel good tonight.

♪ (audience clapping) Mavis Staples.

(audience cheering) ♪ ♪ (clapping) ♪ (Mavis laughing) ♪ (clapping) ♪ Something's happening here ♪ ♪ What it is ain't exactly clear ♪ ♪ There's a man with a gun over there ♪ ♪ Telling me I got to beware ♪ ♪ It's time to stop, what's that sound ♪ ♪ Everybody look what's going down ♪ MAVIS: All right now.

(audience cheering) Y'all can sing this with us.

I know you know it.

♪ Battle lines being drawn ♪ ♪ Nobody's right if everybody's wrong ♪ ♪ Young people speaking their minds ♪ ♪ Getting so much resistance from behind ♪ ♪ It's time to stop, what's that sound ♪ ♪ Everybody look what's going down ♪ ♪ Yeah ♪ ♪ ♪ What a field day for the heat ♪ ♪ 1000 people in the street ♪ ♪ Singing songs and carrying signs ♪ ♪ Mostly sayin' hooray for our side ♪ ♪ It's time to stop, what's that sound ♪ ♪ Everybody look what's going down ♪ ♪ Yeah ♪ ♪ Yeah, yeah ♪ ♪ Oh yeah ♪ ♪ Paranoia strikes deep ♪ ♪ Into your life it will creep ♪ ♪ It starts when you're always afraid ♪ ♪ Step out of line ♪ ♪ The man comes and takes you away ♪ ♪ It's time to stop, what's that sound ♪ ♪ Everybody look what's going down ♪ ♪ Stop, children, what's that sound ♪ ♪ Everybody look what's going down ♪ ♪ Stop, what's that sound ♪ ♪ Everybody look what's going down ♪ ♪ Stop ♪ (audience applauding) All right.

All right!

♪ (clapping) ♪ (audience cheering and applauding) Yeah.

Hand writing on the wall.

Well, good evening y'all.

(audience applauding) (Mavis laughing) Woo.

We're so happy to be back home, home again.

(audience applauding) So good to see you all, but so good to be back in Chicago.

(audience cheering) Yeah!

My home town.

The home of the down-home blues.

Muddy Waters.

Koko Taylor.

Buddy Guy.

(audience cheering) The Howlin' Wolf.

Oh, I love that Wolf.

I love the Wolf.

For years I've been trying to, I've been trying to howl.

(laughing) I do, I try.

Sometimes I make it, but most of the time I don't.

(audience laughing) Woo.

(laughing) (audience applauding) Did I do it?

All right.

All right.

If I didn't get good this time, I'll be back.

(audience laughing) Now we've come this evening to bring you some joy, (audience applauding) some happiness, inspiration, and some positive vibrations.

(audience cheering) Yeah.

We want you to feel good, you know, want you to feel good.

We want you to feel better than you felt when you first come up in here.

You know?

I tell you, I'm going to have myself a good time.

(audience cheering) Yeah.

I come up in here to have a good time.

So I ain't gonna let nothing grow under my feet.

I'm going, y'all better get on board.

I tell you.

'Cause this train is moving out.

(audience cheering) This train is bound for glory.

All right.

Get on board.

Get on board.

All right.
